WASHINGTON The U.S. Justice Department is changing its social media policy following a tweet mistakenly sent from the department's official account on Tuesday that called CNN ""the biggest troll of them all

column3: the staff member in the public affairs office ""erroneously used the official Department of Justice Twitter handle to post a tweet that was intended for a personal account.""The statement did not identify the staff member
column4: but said the person's access to the department's social media accounts had been revoked.

column1: Going forward

column3: the statement said. The tweet was sent early on Tuesday in response to a CNN story about the campaign of Donald Trump denying his wife Melania's speech at the Republican Nominating Convention was plagiarized from a 2008 speech by first lady Michelle Obama.

Protesters for and against Trump faced off in a plaza a few blocks from the site of the Republican National Convention in downtown Cleveland on Monday
column2: shouting slogans at each other but avoiding physical confrontation. Dozens of protesters were separated by a wall of police that looked equal in number. To one side of the police line at the foot of the Key Tower

column5: ""Black Lives Matter."" From the other side came
column6: ""You're a bunch of anarchists.""The exchanges marked the first emotionally charged demonstration at the 2016 Republican National Convention
column7: where security forces are on alert for potentially disruptive conflicts.
